title: Rohit Sharma Likely To Retire After Sydney Test: Report - News18
summary:
Rohit Sharma Likely To Retire After Sydney Test: Report

Date: December 30, 2024

Source: News18

Rohit Sharma is reportedly considering retirement from Test cricket after the upcoming Sydney Test, dependent on India's performance in the World Test Championship.

  • Sharma has struggled for runs this series, scoring only 31 runs in five innings.
  • India needs to win the Sydney Test and hope for favorable results in subsequent matches to qualify for the WTC Final.
  • His captaincy has seen India lose five out of the last six Tests played.
“It was the flattest track yet, and India still managed to keep Australia down to chaseable targets.”

Rohit’s potential retirement comes amid challenging performances, and he could leave the game after the Border-Gavaskar Trophy in Sydney if the team does not qualify for the finals.

title: India vs Australia 4th Test Day 5 Highlights: AUS beat IND by 184 runs, take 2-1 lead in Border-Gavaskar Trophy - Hindustan Times
summary:
India vs Australia 4th Test Day 5 Highlights: AUS beat IND by 184 runs

Publication Date: Dec 30, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Australia secured a commanding 184-run victory over India in the 4th Test, taking a 2-1 lead in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy. Pat Cummins played a pivotal role with both bat and ball, earning the Player of the Match title.

  • India started the day needing 340 runs to win but fell short as Australia took seven wickets in the final session.
  • Yashasvi Jaiswal’s solid 84 runs were overshadowed by India’s collapse.
  • Pat Cummins led the Australian bowling attack with three wickets, alongside Scott Boland and Nathan Lyon.
  • India's struggles highlighted ongoing concerns about their top order batting and overall team performance.
  • Rohit Sharma expressed disappointment in failing to capitalize on early chances.
“It is pretty disappointing. It’s not that we went in with the intent of giving up the fight.” - Rohit Sharma

This match emphasized Australia's resilience and strategic prowess, as they now need only a draw in the final Test to clinch the series.
newTitle: Australia Defeats India by 184 Runs in 4th Test, Leading Border-Gavaskar Trophy 2-1

title: WATCH | Travis Head unrolls new celebration after Rishabh Pant wicket, netizens ask ’What’s this about?’ - Mint
summary:
Travis Head's Unique Celebration After Dismissing Rishabh Pant Sparks Confusion and Speculation

Date: December 30, 2024, Source: cricket.com.au

After causing headaches for the Indian team with his batting, Travis Head now has the Indian batsmen scratching their heads with his spin bowling and unique celebrations. Head dismissed Rishabh Pant on the 5th day of the 4th Test, leaving the cricketing world puzzled by his celebratory gesture.

  • Travis Head was brought in to bowl by skipper Pat Cummins, tempting Yashasvi Jaiswal or Rishabh Pant to play big shots.
  • Head's tactic worked, and Pant fell for it, playing a big shot off him and getting out on 30.
  • Head celebrated Pant's wicket with a unique hand gesture that confused many, including cricket fans and players.
  • Team India lost wickets quickly after Pant's dismissal and eventually lost the match by over 184 runs, leaving the Border Gavaskar Trophy series out of their reach.

“Why is he showing to Australian players!!” wrote one user

“What does that sign means. What is Travis Head doing?” wrote another user

Conclusion: While Head's celebration may have been a fun moment for cricket fans, it also highlighted the intense pressure and competition between the Indian and Australian teams during the Test match.

title: While Rohit Sharma has decided to retire after Sydney Test, shouldn't he be saying goodbye right away? - The Times of India
summary:
Rohit Sharma's Test Retirement: Should He Step Down Immediately?

Date & Source: Melbourne, Dec 31, 2024 - The Times of India

Rohit Sharma's dismal performance in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy has brought into question his future in Test cricket. With just 31 runs in three Tests, his batting average in 2024 has been in the mid-20s. This, combined with his tactics as captain, has raised concerns about his continuity in the team.

  1. Rohit's batting struggles: Only 619 runs in 14 Tests, with just two centuries and two half-centuries.
  2. Captaincy and reputation: Despite poor form, Rohit has been retained due to his captaincy and reputation.
  3. Experimentation in Melbourne: Playing Rohit at the top, KL Rahul at No. 3, and benching Shubman Gill did not yield positive results.
  4. Transition to next generation: Delaying Shubman Gill's opportunities and KL Rahul's return to a familiar batting position hinders the team's progress.

Quotes:

Will Rohit follow suit (retiring mid-series like MS Dhoni) or wait for the 'why nots' to get louder?

Conclusion: With Rohit's retirement seemingly imminent, the focus should be on a smooth transition to the next generation of players.
newTitle: Rohit Sharma's Test Retirement: Should He Step Down Immediately?

title: Watch: Yashasvi Jaiswal Victim Of Huge DRS Controversy, Confronts Umpires At MCG - NDTV Sports
summary:

Publication Date: December 30, 2024 Source: NDTV

Indian cricketer Yashasvi Jaiswal faced a significant controversy during the fourth Test match in Melbourne due to a contentious DRS decision that led to his dismissal.

  • Jaiswal was in strong form but was caught behind off Pat Cummins.
  • The on-field umpires did not see a solid contact, but Australia opted for a review.
  • No clear edge was detected on the snickometer, but the third umpire overturned the decision based on perceived glove contact.
  • Jaiswal confronted the officials following the ruling, expressing his discontent.
  • Former players including Sunil Gavaskar and Deep Dasgupta opposed the third umpire’s decision.
“There was no spike on the snickometer or any distinct sound...”

This incident has sparked major discussions about the DRS system and its implementation, as well as questions regarding officiating in high-stakes matches.
newTitle: Yashasvi Jaiswal Involved in DRS Controversy at MCG

title: IND vs AUS, 4th Test: Why was Jaiswal given out despite no edge on Snicko? - Sportstar
summary:
IND vs AUS, 4th Test: Why was Jaiswal given out despite no edge on Snicko?

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: The Hindu

The dismissal of Yashasvi Jaiswal during the fifth day of the fourth Test in Melbourne created controversy as he was given out despite the Snickometer showing no edge. Australia reviewed the decision after Jaiswal miscued a hook shot from a delivery by Pat Cummins.

  • Jaiswal was batting on 84 when he was given out.
  • On-field umpire Joel Wilson initially turned down the caught behind appeal.
  • The third umpire ruled there was a deflection despite no spike on the Snickometer.
  • Jaiswal contested the decision vocally before leaving the field.
  • This incident raised questions about the adequacy of available technology for clear decisions.
“Probably only HotSpot could have resolved that one,” said Warren Brennan, owner of the Snicko operating company.

The controversy highlights the ongoing debates regarding the effectiveness of cricket technology in decision making.
newTitle: Controversial Wicket: Jaiswal's Dismissal in 4th Test Raises Eyebrows

summary:
Title: Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's Retirement: When, Not If?

Date & Source: January 10, 2023 - Indian Express

It's no longer a case of if, but when will Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma call it a day? After a disappointing series against Australia, speculation is rife about the retirement of these two cricket legends.

  1. The 50-over Champions Trophy is just 50 days away, and their decision might come before or after that.
  2. There's also the possibility of an announcement during the fifth and final Test in Sydney.
  3. Rohit Sharma's performance in the fourth Test was a mix of promise and disappointment, raising questions about his future in Test cricket.
  4. Virat Kohli's mental discipline and form have been a talking point throughout the series, with the Australian crowd even booing him during the fourth Test.

"There has been a shoulder barge, luckily there was a hundred at Perth, but my takeaway of Kohli isn’t anything from this series; I shall happily takeaway memories from what he has done here in the past. We Australians haven’t seen the best of Rohit in Tests, but as said, he seems past it." - Jim Maxwell, ABC radio commentator

Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli have been stalwarts of the Indian cricket team for years, and their retirement would mark a significant change in the team's dynamics. The cricket fraternity and fans worldwide await their decision with bated breath.
newTitle: Is Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's Retirement Imminent?
